page.title: 13Famous Names
page.content: In the council estate behind our school, most of the streets are named after local place-names, but there are two streets with interesting names. They are called{Clapperton Road}and {Caledonian Crescent.}Sir Hugh Clapperton was a famous explorer in Africa. The name Caledonian refers to the name of the railway company, who operated a line between{Lockerbie}and{ {Annan.}The line has not been used for many years and the railway cutting near the school is now used as a waste pipeline from the nearby{Chapelcross {Nuclear Power Station}to the Solway Firth.
